description.p: Fighters of the Stone Warrior archetype exemplify the pinnacle of resilience and persistance They model themselves after the stone's raw durability and strength, but also its versatility. On top of boasting incredible defense, they learn techniques that are useful in a wide array of situations.

description.p: Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you've taken on the unmoving nature of stone. You have advantage against saving throws to resist being stunned or frightened and have immunity to being petrified.

description.p: At 7th level, you embody the resilience of stone. If you end your turn without moving you +2 to your AC until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: At 7th level, you embody the resilience of stone. If you end your turn without moving you +2 to your AC until the start of your next turn.

description.p: At 10th level, you can imitate how difficult it is to move through certain rocks. When you hit a creature with a melee attack you can "weigh it down". If you do so, its walking speed is halved and it can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature 3 times per short rest.

description.p: At 15th level, you can embody the jagged and sharp edges of volcanic glass. When you take damage from an enemy within melee range you can use your reaction to counter attack and make a melee strike against that creature.

description.p: At 18th level you understand the true nature of stone. As an action, you can turn yourself into stone for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to break it. This is not petrification and you are still able to function normally but gain the following benefits:
You gain resistance to slashing, piercing, cold, fire and psychic damage
You have immunity to poison and necrotic damage
The bonus AC given by Toughness of Granite is +5
When you use Impassibility of Sandstone feature the creature has its speed reduced to 0
When you use your Sharpness of Obsidian feature you deal an additional 2d8 damage
